changelog.change: Fixed an issue with animated GIFs no longer animating.
Changed the way that the livesplit-core library is built, which may help with compatibility for some users.
SRL race titles are now only updated when the Races menu is open.
Fixed support for some components that manage hotkeys.
Fixed the Settings dialog always selecting the first hotkey input.
Fixed an issue with loading splits from a URL.
Fixed an issue with the auto updater not working if the update was performed too soon.
Fixed an issue with opening some splits files.
LiveSplit now starts faster because gamepads are loaded in the background on startup.
You can now have multiple Hotkey Profiles in the Settings.
You can now hold shift while resizing to maintain a consistent aspect ratio.
There is now an option in the Layout Settings to ignore the mouse while the timer is running and the window is not in focus.
You can now set the same icon for multiple splits at the same time.
Splits are now parsed with the livesplit-core library.
Credentials are now stored with the Windows Credentials API.
Updated to use .NET 4.6.1.
Fixed some other small bugs.
Fixed sharing runs to Speedrun.com.
Fixed screenshots sometimes not showing all splits.
Changed character limit for sharing to Twitter from 140 to 280.
Extremely long SRL race titles are now shortened in the Races menu.
Fixed a crash when removing all segments in the Splits Editor.
Fixed a crash when the font size is manually set to zero.
Fixed a crash in the Splits Editor when a Speedrun.com variable has no values.
Fixed the segment history sometimes not being cleared when deleting a best segment.
Times and split names can now be copied and pasted in the Splits Editor.
Game Time is now included when sharing to an Excel sheet.
Several bugs and issues have been fixed.
The Blank Space component has been added, which allows you to add empty space to your layout.
Text Outline size scaling has been improved.
Disabled Anti-Aliasing now takes priority over Text Outlines, so text without Anti-Aliasing will not have Text Outlines.
Several bugs and issues have been fixed.
A new setting, "Text Outlines Color", has been added to the Layout Settings.
The Split Key can once again be used to clear the splits of a finished run.
Several bugs and issues have been fixed.
A new comparison, "Latest Run", has been added. This comparison shows the most recent finished run. If you haven't finished a run yet, it shows the run that got the furthest.
"Undo All Pauses" has been added to the Control menu. This reverts the timer to what it would be at if you had never paused, which is useful if you pause accidentally.
Multiple segments can now be moved up or down at the same time in the Splits Editor.
The total amount of time paused in each run is now stored in the splits file.
Other processes can now interact with LiveSplit locally with a Named Pipe.
Many bugs and issues have been fixed.
LiveSplit can now be minimized by clicking on the icon in the taskbar.
Fix an issue with the Live Segment always being shown when behind.
Fix an error that occurred when scrolling through fonts.
Fix some components not updating properly when moving them around in the Layout.
Fix components sometimes being invisible when added to the Layout.
Improve the logic for determining whether a segment is a Best Segment.
Fix the run being wrongly unassociated after submitting to Speedrun.com.
Fixed an issue with sharing to Twitter showing that the tweet failed.
Fixed not being able to save splits that were imported from WSplit.
Some other small issues have been fixed.
Splits can now be opened from a Speedrun.com Run URL.
Fixed comparisons not updating when modifying times.
Fixed some issues with the Segment History.
The Timing Method is now remembered for each set of splits.
Fixed an issue with the Sum of Best being imported wrong.
Fixed a bug with Category Name abbreviations.
Background Images can now be used as a part of the Layout.
Runs can now be submitted to Speedrun.com.
The World Record and Total Playtime components were added.
A Rainbow Best Segment Color can now be used instead of just a solid color.
Timing has been improved by syncing with an NTP server and correcting CPU timer drift based on the results.
New comparisons, "Balanced PB" and "Worst Segments", have been added.
There is now an "Other..." button in the Splits Editor that allows you to Clean Sum of Best, Clear Times, or Clear History.
There is now an "Additional Info" tab in the Splits Editor that allows you to set the Region, Platform, Variables, and view rules for the category.
The Browse Splits.io dialog has been replaced by the Browse Speedrun.com dialog, which allows you to download splits from a chosen leaderboard.
Users can now select which comparisons are active in the Settings.
The recently used splits list is now grouped by Game and Category.
There are no longer "This font is not supported" errors.
Dates and times of attempts are now stored in the Attempt History in the Splits.
Parsing Splitty, Urn, FaceSplit, and Portal 2 Live Timer splits is now supported.
Many bugs and issues have been fixed.
Fixed a bug.
Fixed AutoSplitters.
Some bugs have been fixed.
Fixed a bug with LiveSplit crashing on start up.
Some bugs have been fixed.
Moving Splits up and down is now possible in the Run Editor.
Added the Subsplits Component that allows hiding smaller splits.
Added a Splits.io Browser that allows searching and downloading splits from Splits.io.
Splits can now be exported to Excel Sheets via the Share Menu which allows for easy analyzing and visualization of the splits.
Improved calculation for Average Segments.
Other minor bugs have been fixed.
SRL Racing comparisons should now work properly.
Other minor bugs have been fixed.
Fixes for SRL Racing have been made.
Auto Splitters don't show up in the Layout Editor anymore.
Other minor bugs have been fixed.
An issue with LiveSplit sometimes freezing should now be resolved.
Hotkeys should be working better now.
Fixes for SRL Racing have been made.
Other minor bugs have been fixed.
Hotfix for Video Component not working.
Game Time is now being tracked as well as Real Time all the time. Components can provide the Game Time. You can switch between Game Time and Real Time in Compare Against.
Auto Splitters are automatically being suggested in the Run Editor if they are available for a specific game. If activated, they automatically get downloaded and don't need to be part of the layout.
The Video Component allows you to show a PB or WR video that is synced up to the current run time.

The Delta Component displays the current delta to a comparison, which is useful for races and comparisons like "World Record" where it shows how far you're ahead or behind without having to use a splits component.
The Manual Game Time Component allows inserting the Game Time manually as segment times or split times for console games like Sonic where Game Time is used instead of Real Time.
The Sound Effects Component allows customizable sound effects to be played in certain situations.
Some of the optional components on the website are now part of the standard LiveSplit (Hotkey Indicator and Current Comparison).
Components are now categorized to allow for more components without them being a mess.
Information Components now show shorter information names instead of cutting them off which allows for thinner layouts.
A new Hotkey API is being used, which should remove some bugs that removed the Hotkeys in LiveSplit 1.3.

A "Simple Sum of Best Mode" is now available which improves the performance for the Sum of Best calculation, but also might make it less accurate. This is useful for slow PCs or splits with a large segment history.
The default layout was updated to include all of the new features that have been added since LiveSplit 1.0.
SpeedRunsLive Racing is working again and a lot of issues have been fixed.
Layouts automatically get placed on the screen if a layout that's outside of the screen gets opened.
Scriptable Auto Split allows you to write scripts for Auto Splitting and Game Time.
The overall performance in LiveSplit has been improved.
Various bugs and crashes have been fixed.
WE ACCIDENTALLY KILLED THE UPDATER IN 1.3. PLEASE DO NOT UPDATE IF YOU ARE ON 1.3. IF YOU ARE, GO TO LIVESPLIT.ORG TO DOWNLOAD THE NEW VERSION.
You can compare not only to your Personal Best now, but also to other comparisons.
You can compare to automatically generated comparisons like your Best Segments.
You can define your own comparisons that you can run against. (You can delete custom comparisons by right clicking their column header in the splits editor)
You can import a comparison from splits either from a file or from a URL.
You can attend SpeedRunsLive Races without the need for an IRC client.
When racing on SpeedRunsLive, live comparisons for the other runners automatically get created.
You can watch races by using different race viewers.
The CPU usage has been drastically reduced.

Sharing splits to splits.io via the built-in sharing functionality and using "Open Splits From URL..." or "Import Comparison From URL..." allows for easy sharing of your splits without any loss of information now.
You can use the Text component for showing additional information that your stream's viewers might be interested in.
You can use the Run Prediction component to predict the final time of your run based on a comparison of your choice (using Average is recommended).

You can use the Current Comparison component to show which comparison you're currently running against. This is both useful for your viewers and for you when using the hotkeys to switch between them. (Available separately on livesplit.org)

You can use the Hotkey Indicator component to visualize whether global hotkeys are activated or not. LiveSplit itself has a hotkey indicator in the taskbar, but in some cases this component might be useful. (Available separately on livesplit.org)
Background colors and gradients are supported everywhere now.
You can scroll through your splits at any time now by simply using your mouse wheel.
Components can be configured to always be comparing to a specific comparison.
An indicator in the taskbar shows whether your global hotkeys are activated if you have defined a "Toggle Global Hotkeys" hotkey.
The control section in the context menu allows for controlling LiveSplit or individual components without the need for a hotkey.
Components can now be dragged around in the Layout Editor for easier editing of the layout.
Fonts for times are now automatically monospaced to remove the variance in numerical character sizes.
You can now set the font size for all fonts, including the Timer font.
You can edit your splits mid-run now.
You can define a delay for your hotkeys now, so that the splits match your capture card's delay.
You can now save a screenshot of LiveSplit via the Share window.
You can share a screenshot of LiveSplit to Imgur.
You can attach splits when sharing, so that others can use your splits.
WSplit's old run is being imported as an additional comparison.
You can now use modifier keys together with normal keys as hotkeys.
You can deactivate the hotkeys for other programs so that you don't accidently control them by pressing the hotkeys.
Components that have a lot of space around them now share their space to reduce unnecessary spacing.
Separators are now sharper and thus look better than before.
Components now have full access over LiveSplit which allows for auto splitting components.
ShitSplit splits and Time Split Tracker splits can now be opened as well.
Various bugs and crashes have been fixed.
Added the Detailed Timer.
Moved all Component Settings to the Layout Settings.
Changed Timing System to use Triple Modular Redundancy to make it more robust.
Sharing to Congratsio is now supported.
Allowed Sharing even without a PB.
Added Format Buttons for Sharing.
Made pressing the Split Key update the Times when the Run is over.
Made pressing the Split Key resume when the Timer is paused.
Added a Button to set LiveSplit's size numerically in Layout Editor.
Made Split Countdown not appear when reaching Best Segment if Show Best Segments is off.
Made Update Message have a scroll bar in future versions.
Added an Option to change the Opacity of LiveSplit.
Made pause hotkey "none" by default.
Fixed a bug where the layout size was wrong when opening a layout.
Font sizes are now changeable.
Gamepads can now be used.
GIF animations are now supported.
The timer can now be paused.
Changed the keyboard API to work better.
Game Icons can now also be opened from URLs.
Implemented Anti-Aliasing options.
An optional warning message asks you if you want to save your best segments on resetting.
Implemented an option to turn off drop shadows.
Implemented a hotkey to activate and deactivate global hotkeys.
Global hotkeys are now disabled by default.
Fixed a bug where LiveSplit didn't start when having the file extensions already registered from a different program.
Fixed the OBS plugin installation.
Fixed a bug where the color picker would cause a crash.
